body: Just as a settlement can have unusual qualities to enhance its statistics, it can also suffer from disadvantages. There's no limit to the number of disadvantages a community can suffer, but most do not have disadvantages, since a settlement plagued by disadvantages for too long eventually collapses. A disadvantage can arise as the result of an event or action taken by a powerful or influential NPC or PC. Likewise, by going on a quest or accomplishing a noteworthy deed, a group of heroes can remove a settlement's disadvantage. Several disadvantages are listed below.
name: Settlement Disadvantages
url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Settlements/Settlements in Play/Settlement Disadvantages

sections.body: The settlement has no leaders—this type of community is often short-lived and dangerous. (Replaces settlement's Government and removes Government adjustments to modifiers; Corruption and Crime +4; Economy and Society –4; Law –6; Danger +20)
sections.name: Anarchy
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Settlements/Settlements in Play/Settlement Disadvantages/Anarchy

sections.body: Some form of curse afflicts the city. Its citizens might be prone to violence or suffer ill luck, or they could be plagued by an infestation of pests. (Choose one modifier and reduce its value by 4)
sections.name: Cursed
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Settlements/Settlements in Play/Settlement Disadvantages/Cursed

sections.body: A powerful group or monster uses the city as its hunting ground. Citizens live in fear and avoid going out on the streets unless necessary. (Economy, Law, and Society –4; Danger +20; reduce base value by 20%)
sections.name: Hunted
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Settlements/Settlements in Play/Settlement Disadvantages/Hunted

sections.body: Because of any number of factors, the settlement is destitute. Poverty, famine, and disease run rampant. (Corruption and Crime +1; decrease base value and purchase limit by 50%; halve magic item availability)
sections.name: Impoverished
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Settlements/Settlements in Play/Settlement Disadvantages/Impoverished

sections.body: The community is suffering from a protracted contagion or malady. (–2 to all modifiers; reduce base value by 20%; select a communicable disease—there's a 5% chance each day that a PC is exposed to the disease and must make a Fortitude save to avoid contracting the illness)
sections.name: Plagued
sections.url: pfsrd://Game Mastery Guide/Rules/Settlements/Settlements in Play/Settlement Disadvantages/Plagued
